basics.name: Yazmin Miller
basics.label: Student Game Developer
basics.summary: A third-year undergraduate student seeking an internship opportunity in programming, game design, 3D modeling, or art for Summer 2024 and beyond.

work.name: Woodbridge Township Recreation Department
work.summary: Prepared painting stations, assisted children and adults in their painting, and led and instructed painting classes.
highlights: Organized and conducted condusive painting lessions
Fostered creative and inclusive learning environment
Provided personalized assistance for individuals of varying skill levels

education.institution: Rochester Institute of Technology, New York, USA
courses: Rich Media Web Application Development I
Data Structure and Algorithms for Games & Simulations II

projects.name: Bloodshed
projects.summary: Collaborated with a team of five students over a semester to create a wave survival hack n' slash game where you use your gained experience to gain more abilities.

projects.name: Audio Visualizer
projects.summary: Designed a web application to display audio frequencies in a visually pleasing way.
highlights: Gained experience using APIs with JavaScript

projects.name: Cataclysm
projects.summary: Coordinated a team to create a board game similar to Life, but set in a post-apocalyptic world.
highlights: Created custom card deck art and lettering
Gained experience developing with Tabletop Simulator

projects.name: Slorpus Slaughter IV: Singular Shoot Soul
projects.summary: Worked with a team of five students over a semester to create a challenging physics-based puzzle game.

projects.name: Tarantichrist
projects.summary: Collaborated with one other programmer to create a level-based swinging game for a Halloween-themed 36 hour game jam.
highlights: Created spider sprite, background and menu assets
Was recognized as the most fun and polished submission!
